title: Retrieve the details of a settlement into your bank account
description: Returns Pay Now ledger entries for a settlement into the authenticated user's bank account.
permission_required: MyTradeMeRead: Read your membership & listing data.

path.name: batchId
path.description: The ID of the settlement. This can be retrieved from the Pay Now ledger API.

query.name: page
query.description: The page number of the set of results to return, starting from 1. Defaults to 1.

query.name: rows
query.description: The number of results per page; also the maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 50.

returns.description: <PayNowLedger> Settlement details for the authenticated user.

fields.name: TotalCount
fields.description: The total number of results in the collection. Can be larger than the number of returned results.

fields.name: Page
fields.description: The index of the current page of results (starts at 1).

fields.name: PageSize
fields.description: The number of results in the current page.

fields.name: List
fields.description: A list of the results in the current page.

enum_values.name: PaymentToMemberBankAccount
enum_values.description: A payment to the member's bank account.

enum_values.name: FailedPaymentToMemberBankAccount
enum_values.description: A failed payment to the member's bank account.

nested_fields.description: The transaction date and time. May be blank for

The amount the member's Pay Now account was credited, in NZD, after fees have been accounted for. For example, the sale of an item generates a credit (but that same transaction will be a debit when it is paid into the member's account). This value is never negative.

The amount the member's Pay Now account was debited, in NZD. For example, a refund is a debit (but that same transaction will be a credit when it is in the settlement breakdown). This value is never negative.
The ID of the associated listing, or 0 if there is no associated listing.
The ID of the associated fixed price offer. This value is omitted if the payment is not associated with a fixed price offer.
The purchase-specific ID (or auction sold id).
The title of the associated listing. This value is omitted if there is no associated listing.
The fee associated with the transaction. This value is omitted if there is no associated fee. This value is never negative.
An ID that can be used to get the breakdown of a settlement. Only populated if the payment type is PaymentToMemberBankAccount (or FailedPaymentToMemberBankAccount).
